section.title: Present simple
section.sectiontitle: We use the Present simple for habits / routines or things that are generally or always true.
section.text1a: I go for a run before breakfast every day.
section.sectiontitle2: In the positive, we use I/you/we/they + verb or he/she/it + verb + -s/-es/-ies.
section.text4a: Everyday John gets up at seven, catches the train and then flies to Manchester.

section.title: Present simple
section.sectiontitle: In the negative, we use I/you/we/they + do not + verb or He/she/it + does not + verb. We usually use the short form.
section.sectiontitle2: In the question, we use Do + I/you/we/they + verb or Does + he/she/it + verb.
section.text3a: Do you know Tom? Yes, I do.
section.text4a: Does she eat meat? No, she doesn't.

section.title: Present simple
section.sectiontitle: We use never, sometimes, often, usually/generally, always with the Present simple. These usually come before the main verb but after the verb be.
